term_definitions.items: Additional contextual detail to be applied to all compositions.

The period of care to which this composition belongs. This equates to the CONTSYS concept and repesents an admisitrative or contractual spell of care, involving a specific instiution or care provider.
The identifier of the departmental period of care to which this Composition belongs.
Portlet ID from which stores the information where was the composition saved.
The amount or strength of a medication or substance for medication orders, administrations, dispensing etc.
The value of the amount of medication as a real number e.g 1, 1.5, 0.125.
The dose unit of this medication amount.
Free text description of the amount which may consist of the amount value and amount dose unit.
The denominator value where the amount is described as a ratio e.g. 5mls where the amount is 2mg/ 5mls.
The numerator value where the amount is described as a ratio e.g. 2mg where the amount is 2mg/ 5mls.
The amount or strength of a medication or substance for medication orders, administrations, dispensing etc.
The value of the amount of medication as a real number e.g 1, 1.5, 0.125.
The dose unit of this medication amount.
Free text description of the amount which may consist of the amount value and amount dose unit.
The denominator value where the amount is described as a ratio e.g. 5mls where the amount is 2mg/ 5mls.
The numerator value where the amount is described as a ratio e.g. 2mg where the amount is 2mg/ 5mls.
The amount or strength of a medication or substance for medication orders, administrations, dispensing etc.
The value of the amount of medication as a real number e.g 1, 1.5, 0.125.
The dose unit of this medication amount.
Free text description of the amount which may consist of the amount value and amount dose unit.
The denominator value where the amount is described as a ratio e.g. 5mls where the amount is 2mg/ 5mls.
The numerator value where the amount is described as a ratio e.g. 2mg where the amount is 2mg/ 5mls.
The actual ingredients with strength and overall form of a chemical or medication.
Detailed Information about an individual ingredient.
The name of the chemical or medication.
The detailed chemical name of the compound that is an active ingredient.
The role of the agent. If not stated it will be assumed to be therapeutic.
The chemical has a known and desired effect which is positive.
This chemical is toxic and has no therapeutic effect.
The chemical is active but aids the therapeutic effect of another ingredient.
The chemical has another active role.
The formulation or presentation of the overall substance.
The ingredient is present to prolong the life of the substance.
The ingredient is used to colour the substance.
The strength of an individual ingredient
The amount or strength of a medication or substance for medication orders, administrations, dispensing etc.
The value of the amount of medication as a real number e.g 1, 1.5, 0.125.
The dose unit of this medication amount.
Free text description of the amount which may consist of the amount value and amount dose unit.
The denominator value where the amount is described as a ratio e.g. 5mls where the amount is 2mg/ 5mls.
The numerator value where the amount is described as a ratio e.g. 2mg where the amount is 2mg/ 5mls.
Details of a medication administered by infusion.
The rate at which the infusion is to be administered. Use the Text choice to record non or semi-quantifiable instructions e.g. 1 drop per minute.
The formula used to calculate the Dose Administration rate where this is dependent on some other factor such as patient weight e.g. 10mg/kg/day.
The infusion carries an active pharrmaceutical ingredient.

Any physical object, product, instrument, apparatus, appliance, material or other item used directly or indirectly in the provision of healthcare, but is not used primarily through therapeutic or metabolic means.
Identification of the device. This is very likely to be a coded field, including pre- or post-coordianted details.
The name of the device manufacturer.
Date that the device/product is no longer fit for use.
Additional details to be noted about the device.
Details about safety feature(s) of the device.
Type of safety feature of the device.
Description of the safety feature of the device.
Size of device - a choice of value types is offered - count, quantity or text.
The amount of oxygen being delivered to the subject at the time of observation. Assumed values of 21% O2, Fi02 of 0.21 and Oxygen flow rate of zero.
The amount of oxygen being delivered to the subject at the time of observation. Assumed values of 21% O2, Fi02 of 0.21 and Oxygen flow rate of zero.
Date of last change of filter of T cannula.
Date of last change of filter of T cannula
Close fitting nasal mask for use during non-assisted ventilation.
A nasal catheter designed for high flow administration is used.
A tracheal cannula designed for high-flow administration
The flow rate mode used for oxygen delivery.
A low-flow rate mode of oxygen delivery.
A high-flow rate mode of oxygen delivery.
Style of the oxygen admin unit.
The data and time that the humidifer water was last changed.
Type of humidifer system in use.
Details of mask used to deliver oxygen.
Evidence of skin erythema or redness, related tothe oxygen mask.
Evidence of leakage from the mask.
There is evidence of mask-related erythema.
There is no evidence of mask-related erythema.
The name of the gas administered.
The name of the gas administered.
Details of device or devices used.
Leakage evident from the root of the nose.
Leakage evident from the upper right of the mask.
Leakage evident from the upper left of the mask.
Leakage evident from the lower right of the mask.
Leakage evident from the lower left of the mask.
There are no signs of leakage
Open system - reusable humidifier (water can be manually added).
Closed system - disposable humidifier (water cannot be added without replacing the humidifier container).
Is the gas self-administered by the patient?
Details of the tracheal tube used.
Information about the future or actual administration of medication.
The route by which the medication is administered (e.g. oral, sublingual etc).
A description of the site of administration.
The method of delivery if this should be specified (e.g. via a nebuliser or spacer).
The length of time over which to administer each dose (e.g. an intravenous administration may have to be over a period of 5 minutes).
Details of use, administration, dispensing or other care step relating to a medicine, vaccine or other therapeutic good which may arise from an instruction from a clinician.
The medication is planned but no execution has taken place.
The instruction has issued as an item on a prescription.
The medication has been taken by the patient for the first time.
A single administration of the medication has taken place.
The medication has been completed as instructed.
The medication has not been dispensed as supply is not yet available.
The administration of the medication has been suspended.
The medication has been re-prescribed for an existing instruction.
Reissuing of this prescription is not available without some intervention.
The planned administration has been cancelled prior to any administration.
The plan to order medication has been suspended.
The prescription has been cancelled but administration or dispensing may have occurred.
The administration of this medication has been ceased before anticipated completion.
The time to start this medication has been set.
The administration of a medication has been withheld and not given.
An administration of the medication was refused by the subject of care (patient).
The medicine, vaccine or other therapeutic good which was the focus of the action. This element will normally be coded with a medicines terminology but free text may be required in some cases.
The reason(s) the specific action or step was carried out. Note: This is not the reason for the medication instruction, rather the specific reason e.g. for administration.
The quantity of medicine, vaccine or other therapeutic good.
Detailed information about the ingredient(s) including form and strength.
A comment on the action taken.
The sequence number specific to the action being recorded.
Assigned by the manufacturer to identify the manufacturing batch of the item.
Details about the administration of the medicine, vaccine or other therapeutic good.
The name of the person to whom this was dispensed, if not the subject of care.

The number of times the medicine, vaccine or other therapeutic good may still be dispensed without re-issue of a prescription or order. Note: This is the information required by the subject of care and prescriber.
Any instructions given to the subject of care or carer at the time of the action.
A dispensed medication is returned or not collected without use.
A different brand of the same medicine, vaccine or other therapeutic good was substituted for the one nominated in the order.
The number of times this order has been dispensed. The sum of this number minus one and the remaining repeats provides the number of repeats on the original order.
The category of reimbursement or subsidy sought for the item.
A new instruction with changed dose or timing has been created that replaces this one.
The expiry date of the medicine administered as documented by the manufacturer.
The medication order has been changed in a manner which does not require a new instruction/order to be issued, according to local clinical rules.
The medication has been recommended, generally from one clinician to another, where the latter has the responsibility to order/authorise the medication.
Used to compare variance from actual action time where this is not readily calculable from the original instruction.
The datetime at which the action was scheduled to occur.
Defer administration of the medication until a later time.
The number of days of medication which should be supplied, or is already available, in the case of patient 's own supply.
Link to the original medication record.
The medication supply has been dispensed.
The medication supply has been requested.
The category of medication supply required.
The medication is supplied from ward stock.
The medication is not supplied from ward stock.
The medication is available from the patient's own supply.
The medication is supplied to allow the patient to take home.
The amount of a medication or substance for medication orders, administrations, dispensing etc.
The dose unit of this amount.
Free text description of the amount which may consist of the quantity and dose unit.
A clinical activity that has been carried out for therapeutic or diagnostic purposes.
Detailed structure describing the procedure carried out, including preparation and details about the method and equipment/devices used.
Was the intervention regarded as unsuccessful, from a clinical perspective? True if unsuccessful.
Details about any complication arising from the procedure.
Multimedia representation of the procedure, including images.
The reason or indication for the procedure.
An unplanned event prior to or related to the procedure, which may affect its execution e.g patient self-removed cannula.
The number of failed attempts to perform the procedure.

Record information about unplanned or unexpected activities that needed to be done during the procedure. Record the name of the task and a description within this archetype, but detail should be recorded in specific linked INSTRUCTION or ACTION archetypes.
Description of additional task performed during the procedure.
Link to a detailed record of the additional task.
Narrative description about the procedure carried out.
Details about the anatomical site of procedure.
Identification of specific methods or techniques used for procedure or intervention.
Name of additional task performed during the procedure.
The local ID assigned to the order by the healthcare provider or organisation requesting the service.
Details about the healthcare provider or organisation requesting the service.
The ID assigned to the order by the healthcare provider or organisation receiving the request for service. This is also referred to as Filler Order Identifier.
Details about the healthcare provider or organisation receiving the request for service.
Descriptions of variance in the procedure performed from that requested.
Details of information required to support process and other local requirements.
A section containing medication orders and their associated actions.
Action carestep associated with medication orders.
Generic encounter or progress note composition

The datetime at which the action was scheduled to occur.

Zdravilo, ki ni bilo dano pacientu zato, ker ga je pacient zavrnil
Ime osebe, komu je zdravilo razdeljeno
tevilo ponovnih izdaj zdravila za katere ni potrebno imeti dodatnega naroila. Te informacije lahko zahteva pacient ali predpisovalec zdravila.
Povrnjeno izdano zdravilo, ki ni bilo uporabljeno
Druga znamka zdravila z enakim uinkom
tevilo izdaj zdravila. Vsota tega tevila in tevila ponovitev izdaj predstavlja izdano koliino originalnega naroila.
*A new instruction with changed dose or timing has been created that replaces this one.(en)
*The expiry date of the medicine administered as documented by the manufacturer.(en)
*The medication order has been changed in a manner which does not require a new instruction/order to be issued, according to local clinical rules.(en)
* Used to compare variance from actual action time where this is not readily calculable from the original instruction.(en)
*The datetime at which the action was scheduled to occur.(en)
*Defer administration of the medication until a later time.(en)
